segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes with such focus, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing onto the floor, soaking her shoes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron is spotless, but the puddle around her feet is growing by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s lost in thought or just really loves polishing plates.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is a mess, but she’s completely unaware, and that’s what scares me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might slip any second if she takes one wrong step.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is running freely, and she’s just standing there, oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned around to see the chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to something, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she notices before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
